statement will reflect the date of the disbursement scheduled by Prodigy
Finance in agreement with the Office of the Registrar. Prodigy Finance pays 3
weeks after students have started courses, i.e second or third week of
September in agreement with ESSEC Registrar.

**Please understand that the Office of the registrar cannot enter the amount
to be refunded nor the date in your ledger unless you completed Step 3.**

  

5\. When funds are disbursed, ESSEC will convert the amount received based on
the exchange rate of the day of payment.

  

6\. In case of a balance in favor of the student after the amount has been
applied against tuition, ESSEC will transfer the difference to the student's
bank account provided that the student entered his/her bank account details in
MyRegistrar.

  

7\. On the other hand, in case the loan amount is not sufficient to cover the
tuition fees, the student is responsible for paying the difference.

Financial Aid : Loans / Prêts.page_content:
In case you are an American citizen or a permanent resident of the USA who
would like to apply for a Direct Loan and/or a PLUS loan,**please read the
attached document carefully and proceed as per the instructions given in the
lower left corner of the Loan Flowchart**. It describes the steps you have to
follow so we can review your data, calculate the loan amount you are eligible
for and send you confirmation of the disbursement amounts as well as the
disbursement dates in the so-called "Visa Letter". Indeed this document may be
required by the French consulate when verifying your financial resources.

  

Once your US loans (Direct and/or PLUS) have been certified by ESSEC, the
ESSEC payment deadlines no longer apply to you. The registrar's office will
modify your ledger as per the disbursement schedule of your US loans. See the
dates in [ESSEC US Loans website](https://sites.google.com/a/essec.edu/essec-
us-direct-loans/).

  

Please note that only students enrolled at **ESSEC Cergy** are eligible.

Please note that students enrolled in ESSEC Singapore **may not** be eligible
for US federal aid.

Please note that no online course is permitted or the entire program loses its
eligibility for federal aid. At this date Congress made an exception to the
law only during the Covid-19 period and has not yet voted any change of the
law.

  

For full details on eligibility, procedure, amounts, disbursements, please
consult [ESSEC US Loans website](https://sites.google.com/a/essec.edu/essec-
us-direct-loans/)

Eligibility criteria are most important as foreign schools are governed by
different regulations from those applying to US domestic schools.

Financial Aid : Loans / Prêts.page_content:
INFIИITE propose un prêt à taux 0, sans garant, s’élevant jusqu’à 45 000 euros
pour vous accompagner sur 2, 3 ou 4 ans d’études. À travers cette offre aux
conditions avantageuses, nous souhaitons adresser les freins qui vous
empêchent de financer vos études.

  

Vous pouvez également faire une demande pour un prêt s'élevant à moins de 45
000 euros, en fonction de vos besoins.

  

INFIИITE repose sur un modèle perpétuel et solidaire, où l’argent remboursé
sera utilisé pour financer le prochain étudiant. Nous créons ainsi une chaîne
de solidarité entre les bénéficiaires.

  

Les étudiants qui souhaitent bénéficier de ce prêt doivent postuler
directement sur le site dont voici le lien :
[https://infinite.study/language/fr/accueil/](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__infinite.study_language_fr_accueil_&d=DwMFaQ&c=oS_0xOYps7FNW56RWijYeQ&r=DDwSN7ffg_nzKx0EGpNVJtOgKQlIIZxXue4nGHN3MMc&m=RBctZmQUWDUp1K8Cfu6TjvXOj4BXLcM07mXhD5XezO4EuZzQJ6cUOF2x7uurCeGM&s=TrzeQRcE-
bicPP_RqAeWt9zjZcedpxMYZMFTwcS2pPQ&e=)

  

**Quelles sont les conditions nécessaires pour bénéficier d’INFIИITE ?**

  

Être soit citoyen français, soit avoir le statut de réfugié reconnu par
l’Ofpra, ou bénéficier de la protection temporaire ou subsidiaire, ou être
titulaire d’une carte de séjour temporaire ou d’une carte de résident et être
domicilié en France depuis au moins 2 ans et attester d’un foyer fiscal de
rattachement en France depuis au moins 2 ans. (NB : Notre service n’est par
ailleurs pas à destination de résidents italiens. Toute demande de résidents
italiens sera rejetée).

  

Être admis ou être actuellement étudiant dans l’un de nos établissements
partenaires ou dans une université/école figurant parmi les meilleures dans
leur domaine (même si elle n’est pas partenaire). Il doit vous rester au
minimum deux années à financer.

  

Être alumni de l’une de nos deux institutions partenaires (United World
Colleges ou Télémaque) et être admis ou être actuellement étudiant dans une
université ou une grande école avec encore au minimum deux années à financer.

  

Rencontrer des difficultés financières pour financer vos études supérieures.
Il n’est pas nécessaire d’être boursier du Crous, mais vos besoins financiers
doivent atteindre des niveaux équivalents ou importants.

  

  

**Quel est le processus de sélection ?**

  

⇒ La sélection se fait en deux étapes. Tout d’abord, une présélection basée
sur les réponses du questionnaire. Si vous êtes présélectionné, vous devez
passer un entretien en visioconférence.

  

  

⇒ Choisissez votre session de candidature en fonction de la date d’admission
dans votre université. Vous devez être admis avant de postuler ou être déjà
élève là bas. Vous trouverez les dates des sessions de sélection sur le
[formulaire de candidature. ](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSea-
Ul45IGccxk0l2Yl8qSH7qPQOhsFdL39iHKlMTaCLf6Jbw/viewform)

  

  

Chaque année, plusieurs sessions de sélection sont organisées. Vous devez
postuler durant l’une de ces sessions.

les différentes dates de candidature :

\- AVRIL : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 18 avril - nous vous
répondrons dans les jours qui suivent

\- MAI : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 23 mai - nous vous
répondrons dans les jours qui suivent

\- JUIN : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 12 juin - nous vous
répondrons dans les jours qui suivent

\- JUILLET : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 15 juillet - nous

\- SEPTEMBRE : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 10 septembre -
nous vous répondrons dans les jours qui suivent

\- OCTOBRE : vous pouvez poser votre candidature jusqu'au 17 octobre - nous
vous répondrons dans les jours qui suivent

Student Card.page_content:
Votre carte d’étudiant ESSEC est une **carte internationale ISIC**.

Elle vous est remise pour toute votre scolarité, et sa validité sera
automatiquement prolongée chaque année ([carte virtuelle via l'appli ISIC
France](https://isic.fr/page/app-isic-france)). **Vous pouvez trouver ci-joint
le process d'activation de votre carte virtuelle.**

  

Votre carte ISIC vous offre de nombreux avantages en France comme à
l’étranger, à découvrir sur[
](https://sites.google.com/a/essec.edu/rentreeetudiant/goog_57846055)[www.isic.fr](http://www.isic.fr/).

  

Sur le campus, elle est votre :

  * carte de contrôle d’accès
  * carte de bibliothèque
  * porte-monnaie pour la restauration et les distributeurs automatiques ([recharger](http://ernest.essec.edu/solution/articles/7000009273-comment-recharger-mon-compte-restauration-))
  * porte-monnaie pour les photocopies et impressions ([recharger](https://registraratessec.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/7000009279-comment-recharger-mon-compte-impression-))

  

**Attention les deux porte-monnaie sont indépendants** : l'argent chargé sur
le compte restauration ne peut pas être utilisé pour les impressions, et
inversement.

  

Par défaut, une carte ISIC est valide jusqu'au 31 décembre. Cela vous permet
de bénéficier de réductions pour étudiants lorsque vous allez au cinéma, au
musée, etc.

La date du 31 décembre ne reflète aucunement votre statut réel d'étudiant
inscrit ou diplômé de l'ESSEC. Par exemple, pour la Grande Ecole, le jury de
diplôme a lieu mi-juillet.

Si vous êtes diplômé(e) par le jury, vous ne serez donc plus étudiant à partir
de la date du jury.

\---

_Your ESSEC student card is**an international ISIC****card** .  
It is handed to you for all your schooling period, and its validity is
automatically extended every year ([virtual card via ISIC France
App](https://isic.fr/page/app-isic-france)). **You can find attached the
process to activate your virtual card.**  
_

  

_Your ISIC card offers you numerous advantages in France as well as abroad,
discover on_ _[www.isic.fr](http://www.isic.fr).  
  
On the campus, it is your:_

  * _Control Access card _
  *  _Library card_
  *  _Electronic purse for Catering ([ credit my card](https://ernest.essec.edu/solution/articles/7000009273-comment-recharger-mon-compte-restauration-))_
  * _Electronic purse for copies and printings ([ purchase printing units](https://registraratessec.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/7000009279-comment-recharger-mon-compte-impression-))___

  

_**Note that the two wallets are separate** : the money credited on the
cafeteria account cannot be used for printing, and vice versa._

  

_By default an ISIC student card is valid until 31 December. This allows you
to benefit from student discounts when you go to the movies or the museum,
etc._

_The date of 31 December is not linked to your actual academic status, either
enrolled at ESSEC or graduated from ESSEC. For instance, ESSEC Grande Ecole
graduation jury takes place mid-July._

_In case you are declared graduated by the jury, you'll no longer be an
enrolled student._

Student Card.page_content:
(English version below)

  

Nous ne délivrons plus de timbre de revalidation à apposer au dos de votre
carte.

L'extension de validité de votre carte est désormais digitale.

En effet, en plus de votre carte plastifiée, vous bénéficiez désormais d'une
version électronique.

  

Pour obtenir votre carte virtuelle, il vous suffit de télécharger
l'application ISIC France.

Il vous sera demandé d'indiquer votre numéro de carte ISIC.

  

A l'entrée et à l'extérieur du campus, c'est votre carte digitale que vous
devrez présenter pour justifier de votre statut d'étudiant : contrôle par les
agents de sécurité, réductions dans les musées, cinémas etc., réductions en
ligne grâce à notre partenaire ISIC (International Student Identity Card).  

  

Cette version digitale ne remplace en aucun cas votre carte physique.

  

A l'intérieur du campus, quelle que soit la date de validité affichée, même
obsolète, c'est votre carte physique que vous devrez utiliser. Elle reste
indispensable pendant toute votre scolarité pour :

  * le contrôle d’accès aux examens

  * l'accès au campus par le tourniquet ou le parking

  * le learning center

  * le porte-monnaie pour la restauration et les distributeurs automatiques

  * le porte-monnaie pour les photocopies et impressions

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

  

We don't deliver stickers anymore to extend the validity of your student card.

The extension is now virtual.

Indeed, as well as your plastic card, you now have the electronic version.

  

To obtain your virtual card, please launch the application ISIC France.
[](https://www.officeoftheregistrar.essec.edu/essec-student-card-app)

You will have to enter your ISIC card number to access to the virtual card.

  

At the entrance and out of the campus, you will need to show this electronic
version to prove your student status : ESSEC Security, discounts in museums,
cinemas..., online benefits thanks to our partner ISIC (International Student
Identity Card) etc.

  

The electronic version doesn't replace the plastic card.

  

On the campus, what ever the validity date, the plastic card is your:

  * Control Access card and exams

  * Library card

  * Electronic purse for Catering (credit my card)

  * Electronic purse for copies and printings (purchase printing units)

Votre "[Pass campus](https://infojeunes.valdoise.fr/vivre-le-campus/#pass-
campus)" vous permet d'obtenir des avantages et réductions auprès des
structures culturelles et sportives de l’agglomération de CERGY-PONTOISE.

  

Le Pass Campus est un dispositif proposé par la Communauté d’agglomération de
Cergy-Pontoise, en partenariat avec le Centre Information Jeunesse du
Val-d’Oise permettant d’avoir des réductions auprès de plus de 30 partenaires
locaux.

  

**Quelles sont les conditions ?**

Étudier dans un établissement d’enseignement supérieur de Cergy-Pontoise ou
étudier et vivre sur le territoire cergypontain.

S’acquitter de la somme de 5 euros au CIJ.

  

**Comment ça marche ?**

Présentez votre carte étudiante aux partenaires afin de bénéficier des tarifs
préférentiels. Vous pouvez l’utiliser autant de fois que vous le souhaitez. Le

Visas.page_content:
1/ Before the first log-in, you should create a personal account and register
to [**”Etudes en
France”**](https://pastel.diplomatie.gouv.fr/etudesenfrance/dyn/public/authentification/login.html?codeLangue=EN)
on the Website of the Campus France office in your country of residence. See
[List of countries where there is a Campus France
procedure](https://www.campusfrance.org/fr/procedure-etudes-en-France).

  

2/ You will receive an email "Account creation confirmation" with a link to
activate your account.

  

3/ Once your account is activated, you log-in to your Campus France portal.
Please read carefully the instructions provided in the User Guide available
online.

  

4/ On Home Page, you click on "Admitted candidate" ("je suis accepté"). Indeed
you already have a letter of admission provided by the Admissions Office at
ESSEC.

  

5/ Complete your application and enter in the corresponding field, the name of
the institution that welcomes you in France: ESSEC-Ecole Supérieure des
Sciences Economiques et Commerciales (which is the complete name of ESSEC) and
the Academic program into which you have been admitted.

  

6/ Upload all the requested documents such as your official letter of
admission into ESSEC which must include your full name as shown in your
passport, the exact start and end dates of the academic program... (Name your
supporting documents clearly and be careful with the format of the documents).

  

7/ Verify your entries and submit. Your application has been submitted to
Campus France.

  

8/ At the end of the procedure, you’ll be able to download an attestation
“Studies in France” (“Etudes en France”). Save and print this attestation
since this document will be required by the French Consulate when you submit
your application for the French visa. **Depending on the country this
attestation could be delivered at your Campus France office.**

  

9/ You will receive notifications in your personal inbox with the amount of
processing fees and the interview appointment notification.

  

**Once you finished the interview and your application is verified by Campus
France, you can continue the process at the French Consulate.**

**[List of French Consulates in the
world](http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/country-files/)**

**[Official website for visa application to France](https://france-
visas.gouv.fr/en/web/france-visas/)**

  

**Caution!** If you are residing in a country other than your country of
origin, to avoid confusion and delays, please let us know.

Example : Li is a Chinese national, born in Beijing, living in Brazil. We
notify Campus France in Beijing and get their reply that they have no trace of
Li's application, hence some delay.

Visas.page_content:
In case you and your partner are not yet married, our first piece of advice is
that you and your partner get legally bound.

Indeed married couples face a lot of requirements, let alone individuals who
do not have any legal bond.

  

As a student a visa applicant is not authorized to work and earn any income.
Therefore, his/her dependent (spouse or child) must provide evidence of
his/her own financial resources during the entire stay in France when applying
for a visa. The dependent will get a visitor's visa and will not be authorized
to work either.

Of course, if the partner/spouse is employed in France, it is an entire
different scenario.

  

In case you are not married nor legally bound, your partner will be considered
as a long stay visitor and will have to provide the French consulate with
solid financial resources.

Also please bear in mind that ESSEC can only validate the enrollment status of
students. Private visa or residence permit applications must be handled by
individuals.

Visas.page_content:
A residence permit from another European Union country allows you to circulate
between that EU country and France, but not necessarily to stay in France to
study.

  

We recommend that you double-check :

\- First, contact the authorities of that EU country where you are currently
living and explain that you will come to France to study temporarily, and then
come back to finish your studies.

\- Secondly, visit the nearest French consulate in your country of current
residence with your residence permit and explain again your situation.

  

Please note that even if you get solid confirmation that your permit will
allow you to study in France, you may not be eligible for French housing
subsidy from the French government.

metadata.Title: J1- Visa for the USA to do an internship / Visa pour les Etats-Unis pour un stage
metadata.Parent: Visas

Visas.page_content:
Non European students holding a French student residence permit must remember
that their French residence permit is valid for France only, allowing them to
reside temporarily in France to study.

This French permit allows them to circulate within the Schengen area, not
reside, especially to do an internship or an exchange program.

  

For example :

Li is a Chinese national, holding a French student residence permit. Li has
relatives in Germany and in Spain. He can go and visit his relatives during
the winter holidays as long as his French permit is valid. Li may evidently
return to France but to play it safe, Li enquired with the German and Spanish
consulate in Paris to verify if he could enter Germany and Spain as a tourist
with his French student residence permit. Double checking is the key word when
national laws can change rapidly.

  

Ashok is an Indian national, also holding a French residence permit. Ashok
should go to Sweden to do a 6-month internship. Since his French residence
permit is valid during the whole duration of his internship, Ashok leaves for
Sweden without carrying out any other formality. Two weeks later, the company
asks for his Swedish work permit. Not being able to provide any such document,
Ashok must immediately leave Sweden.

  

Mario is a Brazilian national, also holding a French residence permit. Mario
has been assigned to the USA for a study abroad semester. Mario has started
applying for his US visa but the American consulate sees that his French
student residence permit is due to expire within the next two months. Because
Mario cannot prove that he'll be authorized to re-enter France once his
exchange program in the USA will have ended, Mario will most likely be denied
his US visa.

  

Conclusion : ESSEC students must plan ahead.

They must verify the validity of their French student residence permit, do the
needful in case the French permit is due to expire shortly or while they are
outside France.

They must enquire at the consulate in Paris of the destination country they
intend to go to, explain clearly the purpose of their visit, justify their
revenues, apply for a visa or a work permit if need be. Depending on student's
nationality, laws of the destination country will vary.

As a French school, ESSEC may not whatsoever intervene in a foreign country's
national laws. It is already ESSEC's first obligation to be in compliance with
the French laws.

Visas.page_content:
"Le traitement d’une seconde demande de visa se déroule comme pour la
première. A second visa application will be processed the same way as the
first one.

1. Les étudiants ne seront en rien pénalisés pour l’absence d’utilisation de leur 1er visa. Students won't be penalized by the fact they did not validate their first visa

2. Ils devront toutefois refaire une nouvelle demande de visa. C’est-à-dire introduire un dossier sur la plateforme Etudes en France et joindre les pièces justificatives. En sus des pièces justificatives habituellement demandées, ils devront également joindre leur relevé de notes 2020/2021 de l’ESSEC et une attestation d’inscription pour l’année 2021/2022. They'll have to submit again a new visa application, i.e complete their file on Etudes en France platform and provide all required documentation. In addition to those, they'll have to provide their ESSEC transcripts for 2020/2021 along with an enrollment certificate for 2021/2022.

3. Comme lors de leur 1ère demande de visa, ils continueront de bénéficier de la procédure simplifiée et seront exemptés d’entretien d’évaluation en cas de dépôt d’une 2ème demande de visa. En général, les dossiers des étudiants bénéficiant d’une exemption (sous réserve que tous les pièces justificatives soient présentes et que les frais de procédure aient été acquittés), sont traités en 1 à 2 semaines. Comme par le passé et pour éviter le rush de l’été, nous invitons les étudiants de l’ESSEC à déposer leur demande de visa dès mai 2021 pour une rentrée fin de l’été 2021.

Like for their first application, they'll still benefit from a simplified
procedure and will be waived the assessment interview. These files (provided
that all required documents are properly submitted and processing fees have
been paid) are usually reviewed in 1 or 2 weeks. To avoid the summer overload,
ESSEC students are recommended to submit their visa application as early as
May for a school start at the end of the 2021 summer."

  

Le 3ème alinéa ne concerne que les étudiants qui déposent leur demande par le
biais de Campus France en Chine. The 3rd item only applies to student who
apply through Campus France in China.

Visas.page_content:
**Do not confuse the Admission Module and the Enrollment Module. See pictures
below to distinguish them : Admission says "Application" whereas Enrollment
says "Inscription", plus the shade of blue is different.**

**Please read all the words of the instructions carefully and use the proper
credentials before and after your payment.**

**Admission Module**

The following 3 steps are handled by the Admission department.

1\. Upon admission, prior to the payment of the deposit, an _acceptance
certificate_ will be made available on the application portal
Essec.myapply.online. It will mention the amount of the deposit to be paid.

  

2\. After you have paid the deposit to secure your seat, an _official
acceptance letter_ will be made available on the application portal
Essec.myapply.online.

**Once you have paid the deposit, you will have to identify yourself with your
ESSEC BID starting with B00 (not your personal mail) and your new password.
The updated acceptance letter will confirm that the deposit has been paid. It
will also indicate the starting date of your program of enrollment that might
be useful for your visa application.**

  

3\. No original acceptance letter will be sent unless you make a specific
request to Admissions. If you need a paper version, please connect again to
Essec.myapply.online and click on “contact us”. In your message, you should
specify your full postal address as well as a valid mobile number (including
country and area codes).

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7046116244/original/m5nZQ5jPFlDsZTE286ip1luw1GoioYh-
mA.png?1585667781)

**Enrollment Module**

The following 2 steps are handled by the Registrar Office.

  1. After you have paid your deposit, you will be invited by the Registrar to complete your online administrative enrollment on the enrollment portal 

essec.inscription.online.

During that process, you will be requested to upload the copy of your passport
as well as your birth certificate in French or English (the translation must
be official).

  

2\. Once your enrollment has been validated by the Registrar and you have
received the email “enrollment file completed”, you will be granted access to
your MyRegistrar intranet :

essec.myintranet.online. From My Documents section, you can download your
enrollment certificate stamped by the Registrar.

Having access to your intranet, you can start paying your tuition fees by bank
card. You can make multiple payments as long as the full amount is settled by
August 31st  of the year of entry or 23rd of July for Global MBA students.

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-

Visas.page_content:
In case you will do an exchange at ESSEC and you have a student residence
permit issued by a European member state, you can apply for the ‘notification
of mobility’. On your residence permit, you should have the inscription
"student-mobility program".

This notification will allow you to spend a period in another European country
without asking for a residence permit.

To obtain the Mobility Program notification you will need to send us the
following supporting documents:

\- Copy of your valid passport

\- Copy of your residence permit from EU member state

\- Proof of sufficient resources (in the student's name) for the mobility
period (615€ per month)

\- Proof of health insurance (EHIC card is sufficient)

\- Letter from your school or university confirming that you will do an
exchange at ESSEC (Erasmus attestation)

\- Proof of acceptance from ESSEC

\- Housing proof in France

Essec will take care of sending the application form (cerfa n ° 15972 * 01)
and the supporting documents to the French administration. Everything must be
transmitted at least two months before the start of the mobility in France.

Note that it is likely that you are not eligible for CAF housing subsidies in
case you come to France with the notification.

  

Please inform us if you are interested in the notification of mobility:
support@registraratessec.freshdesk.com

Visas.page_content:
International students who started their program at Essec Singapore campus and
are registered for courses in Cergy campus for next term need to apply for a
visa to study in France. They are recommended to start the visa application as
soon as possible to avoid any delays during the peak period, and in any case
at least 90 days before the start of classes in France.

  

First they must follow the step-by-step Campus France procedure on "Études en
France" online platform by selecting "I have been accepted" option
[<https://www.singapour.campusfrance.org/i-have-been-accepted>].

**Caution!** The Campus France procedure does not guarantee the issuance of a
visa.

  

After validation by Campus France, they can proceed with the visa application
[<https://www.singapour.campusfrance.org/get-your-visa>] directly at the
French Consulate by registering online via the official visa website for
France “France-Visa” [<https://france-visas.gouv.fr/en/web/france-visas]>.

  
If they return to their country of residence before continuing in Cergy
campus, they will have to proceed as above if their country is affected by the
“Etudes en France" procedure administrated by Campus France. See list of
countries: <https://www.campusfrance.org/en/application-etudes-en-france-
procedure>

  

**Caution!** No organization, individual, or entity has any right in the visa-
granting process, which is the sole responsibility of the French consular
service.

  

Prepare all required documents in advance to submit your visa application on
time: the sooner the better!

  

Once you have got your student visa from the French consulate, you'll have to
upload a scan copy of your visa in the MyRegistrar intranet, section
Administrative Process.

Turning my entry visa into a residence p.page_content:
It stands for Office Français de l'Immigration et de l'Intégration .

Even if your consulate provided you an OFII form together with your visa, the
process for turning your visa into a French residence permit changed at the
end of February 2019 and you no longer have to apply through the OFII
administration.

You must now apply on an online government platform. You will only need your
passport and a bank card as you will be requested to pay a €50 tax.

<https://administration-etrangers-en-france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/>

Once it is done, please upload the validation attestation on your MyRegistrar
intranet.

  

OFII est le sigle d'Office Français de l'Immigration et de l'Intégration.

Même si le consulat vous a fourni un formulaire OFII en même temps que votre
visa, la procédure pour convertir votre visa en titre de séjour français a
changé fin février 2019 et vous ne devez plus déposer de dossier auprès de
l'OFII.

Désormais, vous devez vous inscrire en ligne sur une plateforme mise en place
par le gouvernement français. Les seuls documents dont vous aurez besoin sont
votre visa et une carte bancaire car vous devrez payer une taxe de 50€.

<https://administration-etrangers-en-france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/>

metadata.Title: What is OFII? Qu'est-ce que l'OFII?

Turning my entry visa into a residence p.page_content:
If you were granted a **long stay student visa** or your visa has the
mention******E1 VLSTS VALIDER EN LIGNE** , you must apply on the online
government platform and obtain the visa validation certificate.

**You must validate your visa no later than 3 months following your arrival in
France.**

This replaces the OFII procedure.

  

Visas with the mention **E1 VLSTS VALIDER EN LIGNE** are the same as **R431-16
13.** These visas must be validated online.

  

In order to apply on the dedicated online government platform [
https://administration-etrangers-en-
france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/](https://administration-etrangers-en-
france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/),

you only need your passport and a bank card (for a €50 payment).

  

You will not be requested to upload any documents but you will have to provide
the following information:

\- visa #

\- start and end date of the visa

\- issue date of the visa

\- visa type

\- date of arrival in France (consistent with the airport stamp in your
passport)

\- marital status

\- full address in France

  

Once the online registration is complete, you will be provided a visa
validation attestation which you have to upload on your Myregistrar intranet

  

  

**To start the application go to** <https://administration-etrangers-en-
france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/>

  

  

**Click on:**

  

![](https://eucattachment.freshdesk.com/inline/attachment?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpZCI6NzEwMTgxMTU4NywiZG9tYWluIjoicmVnaXN0cmFyYXRlc3NlYy5mcmVzaGRlc2suY29tIiwiYWNjb3VudF9pZCI6NDUzMTQ4fQ.-9vBReDtYrDseGEsOyXfQuolBiPtzS4nt7OJMZ9Dar0)

  

  

  

**Enter your visa number here (you see it top right of your visa) and follow
the steps:**

  

**![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7135844405/original/wOpBiYhggTqmQHmFlELw4AFxN29tTYBlGA.png?1707729572)**

**Enter the visa details.**

  

  

**The regulatory reference for E1 VLSTS visas is : R431-16 13**

  

  

**Continue to follow the steps and buy the fiscal stamp of 50 euros. Enter the
fiscal stamp number in the platform.**

  

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7135845173/original/E-Z_GP5yagBZpZtA-
usNyGOZiOMAFJCRuQ.png?1707729876)  

  

**If you continue to study in France after the validity of the visa in your
passport: 4-2 months before the expiry date of your visa, you will have to
apply for the renewal on the same platform.**

  

**More information on the renewal procedure:**

[**https://ernest.essec.edu/fr/support/solutions/articles/7000059407-renewal-
of-the-french-residence-permit-new-online-
procedure**](https://ernest.essec.edu/fr/support/solutions/articles/7000059407-renewal-
of-the-french-residence-permit-new-online-procedure)

metadata.Parent: Turning my entry visa into a residence permit in France : OFII / online validation platform

Turning my entry visa into a residence p.page_content:
Yes, if you are holder of a long stay student visa, you can travel abroad
within the first three months after your arrival in France.

That’s the deadline granted by the French administration for you to validate
your visa on their online platform : [https://administration-etrangers-en-
france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/. ](https://administration-etrangers-
en-france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/.%C2%A0)

Beyond three months, do not leave France without the visa validation
certificate which replaces the OFII stamp.

  

Oui, si vous êtes titulaire d’un visa long séjour étudiant, vous pouvez
voyager dans les trois mois suivant la date de votre arrivée en France.

C’est le délai qui vous est accordé par l’administration pour valider votre
visa sur leur plateforme en ligne : <https://administration-etrangers-en-
france.interieur.gouv.fr/particuliers/#/>.

Au-delà de trois mois, ne quittez pas la France avant d'avoir obtenu votre
attestation de validation de visa qui remplace la vignette OFII.

metadata.Title: Can I travel abroad before I validate my visa on the online platform? Puis-je voyager hors de France avant de valider mon visa sur la plateforme en ligne?
metadata.Parent: Turning my entry visa into a residence permit in France : OFII / online validation platform

Turning my entry visa into a residence p.page_content:
Minors are exempted from OFII.

The “visa mineur” holder thus cannot validate his visa on the government
validation platform until his/her visa expires (even after he/she turns 18).

  

**However he/she can and should anticipate his/her application file for a
laminated residence permit as soon as he/she turns 18.**

The residence permit will allow him/her to travel abroad, which he/she cannot
do with the “visa mineur”.

********

Les mineurs sont dispensés d’OFII. Le/la titulaire d’un visa mineur ne peut
donc pas valider son visa en ligne sur la plateforme du ministère de
l'intérieur jusqu’à son expiration (même après avoir eu 18 ans).

**Il/elle peut par contre anticiper sa demande de titre de séjour plastifié
dès qu’il/elle a eu 18 ans, ce qui est recommandé.**

Le titre de séjour lui permettra de voyager, ce que ne lui permet pas le «
visa mineur ».

<https://ernest.essec.edu/fr/support/solutions/articles/7000010069-%C2%AB-
visa-mineur-when-and-how-to-apply-for-a-residence-permit-%C2%BB>

Insurance that I need / Assurance dont j.page_content:
English below ==

L’assurance Responsabilité Civile (RC) couvre les conséquences des dommages
dont vous pourriez être la cause ou l’origine, portés à une tierce partie,
volontairement ou non, lors de vos diverses activités, privées, scolaires ou
extra-scolaires, sur le campus de l’ESSEC, en dehors du campus, en France ou à
l’étranger.

  

Ce type d’assurance ne couvre en aucun cas les dommages à la personne ou aux
biens dont vous pourriez vous-même être victime.

  

Cette assurance fait, en général, partie de celle que vous avez souscrite lors
de la location d’une chambre ou d’un appartement. Par exemple, le contrat
d’assurance de votre chambre dans les résidences de l’Alegessec comporte cette
disposition. Si vous êtes logé à l'hôtel, en co-location sans être titulaire
du contrat d’assurance ou logé à titre grâcieux dans une famille, vous devez
souscrire une assurance Responsabilité civile.

  

Il est de plus en plus fréquent que les entreprises où vous effectuez vos
stages demandent un justificatif de votre Assurance en Responsabilité Civile,
que ce soit en France ou dans un pays étranger.

**Assurez-vous que votre assurance actuelle en Responsablilité Civile est
également valable en cas de stage. Contactez votre assureur en expliquant
clairement ce que vous allez faire.**

  

**Cliquez[ici](https://ernest.essec.edu/support/solutions/articles/7000015078-assurance-
internationale-pour-s%C3%A9jour-hors-de-france-compl%C3%A9mentaire-

étrangers dans le cadre de leurs études.

Ainsi, **Gritchen** a négocié pour l'ESSEC un contrat étudiant multi séjour,

rapport garantie / prix. Depuis le 01/06/2020, ce contrat est enrichi par la
garantie des risques épidémiques en assistance et par l'ajout de la

Cliquez [ ICI](https://www.souscription.safebooking.com/landing/essec/) pour

***

  

_Civil liability insurance covers personal injuries or property damages you
may have caused to a third party, voluntarily or involuntarily, during
private, curricular or extracurricular activities, on or outside ESSEC campus,
in France or abroad._

  

_Please be aware that this type of insurance does not cover any personal
injuries or property damages that you may sustain._

  

_Civil liability is usually included in the housing insurance you subscribe to

Insurance that I need / Assurance dont j.page_content:
Non French, non European Union students are often required by French
consulates to provide proof of their health insurance when they submit their
visa application.

  

Please see our[ FAQ about French Social Security scheme that will cover full-
time students who hold a long-stay visa or a student residence permit as well
as French
nationals](https://ernest.essec.edu/support/solutions/articles/7000015630--
2018-2019-s%C3%A9curit%C3%A9-sociale-et-617-smerep-ou-601-lmde-french-social-
security-health-coverage-and-f).

  

Indeed, students must be covered by their own insurance prior to the beginning
of their course in France.

  

For example: John is enrolled in Grande Ecole MSc, the starting date of which
is scheduled on 27 August. To settle smoothly, John has booked a flight
landing at Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport on 22 August. On his way out of
the airplane, John falls and breaks his leg. He has to be rushed to the
nearest hospital. John's medical expenses should be covered by his personal
insurance because the French Social Security scheme becomes effective only
after the start of his course.

Jane, on the other hand, also enrolled in Grande Ecole MSc, catches a terrible
cold early September a couple of weeks after her arrival from Mexico. Her
medical expenses should be covered by the French Social Security scheme once
she has registered online on Social Security platform.

  

******************

metadata.Title: [French Social Security] scheme for health coverage, general information / Sécurité Sociale (CPAM - Caisse Primaire d'Assurance Maladie)

Social Security Health Plan/ Sécurité So.page_content:
**Upon arrival in France registration is mandatory and will entitle you to
reimbursement of part of your health care expenses.**

  

To be affiliated to the French Social Security Health scheme, you will need to
sign up via the dedicated website **[HERE](https://etudiant-
etranger.ameli.fr/#/) after your arrival **in France.

  

## You will have to complete the 3-step registration process:

1/ Enter your personal information,

2/ Upload the required documents:

  * Enrollment certificate (not the admission letter)
  * Passport
  * Visa
  * Birth certificate (ideally translated into French except if the original version is already in English)
  * Visa validation certificate
  * French bank details

  

3/ Create your "Personal area".

  

Once the documents you submitted upon registration online have been checked
(within 2 to 3 weeks), you will receive an email stating that your coverage
certificate with your temporary social security number (NIA number) can be
downloaded from your "Personal area".

  

If some of your documents are missing or have been rejected, you will receive
an email stating which documents to upload on your "Personal area". This can
slow down the process.

  

Once your registration has been completed and approved (it may take months),
you will be informed that your new coverage certificate with your permanent
French Social Security number (NIR number) can be downloaded from your
"Personal area" and that your file has been transferred to your local CPAM.

  

After this step you will be able to create your [ameli
account](https://assure.ameli.fr/PortailAS/appmanager/PortailAS/assure?_somtc=true)
7 to 10 days after having received the permanent social security number.

Social Security Health Plan/ Sécurité So.page_content:
Si vous êtes étudiant étranger, votre immatriculation (= obtenir un numéro)
peut prendre plusieurs mois. C'est la Sécurité Sociale qui attribue un numéro
de Sécurité Sociale, pas l'ESSEC qui est un établissement d'enseignement,
autrement dit une école.

Vous recevrez par courrier votre numéro de Sécurité Sociale qui sera valable
pour toute votre vie car il contient des données qui, sauf exception,
demeureront inchangées.

  

Un numéro de Sécurité sociale est composé de 13 caractères suivis d'une clé de
contrôle. Voyez ci-dessous comment comprendre et vérifier qu'il s'agit bien de
votre propre numéro de Sécurité Sociale.

  

Pas d'inquiétude, l'immatriculation est distincte de l'affiliation : pendant
que vous serez en cours d’immatriculation, vous pourrez être remboursé de vos
frais de maladie ou faire un stage. C'est l'affiliation qui compte.

*****

If you are a foreign student, your getting a registry number might take a few
months. Social Security numbers are issued by Social Security, French
governmental body, not by ESSEC which is an institution of higher education,
in other words a school.

You’ll be sent by post the long-awaited French Social security number. This
number will remain valid for your whole life since your data, except under
exceptional circumstances, are unlikely to change.

See below how you can understand and verify this is your very own Social
Security number.

Meanwhile you may be reimbursed for the medical expenses incurred or you may
do an internship, since registration and getting a number are two distinct
issues. Just indicate that the procedure is in progress “en cours
d’immatriculation”. A French Social Security number is a 13- digit number,
followed by a 2-digit control key. See below how you’ll be able to decipher
your own number.

  

![](https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/eu-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7004324678/original/Kv12_8sD7GBCFk-
FSBKim-I6MIg2drmCzw?1502108044)

Social Security Health Plan/ Sécurité So.page_content:
English below

\- **Qu'est-ce qu’une mutuelle santé? / What is mutual health insurance?**

\- The purpose of a mutual health insurance is to cover part or all of your
health expenses which are not covered by your compulsory health insurance
(CPAM/Améli). The mutual health or complementary health insurance therefore
supplements the reimbursement of social security.

\- Le rôle d'une mutuelle santé est d'agir en complément de la Sécurité
sociale (CPAM/Améli) pour couvrir les dépenses de santé de leurs adhérents en
partie ou en totalité.  
La mutuelle ou la complémentaire santé complète donc le remboursement de la
sécurité sociale.

===

\- **Is a « Mutual » health insurance mandatory ? / Une “mutuelle” santé est-
elle obligatoire ?**

\- The complementary health insurance, or mutual health insurance, covers your
health expenses not covered by the Social Security health insurance System
(CPAM/Améli). Although it is not mandatory, we strongly recommend that you
subscribe. It will be very useful if you are sick, if you need to undergo a
medical examination or if you have to be hospitalised.

\- La complémentaire santé, ou mutuelle santé, prend en charge vos dépenses de
santé non couvertes par l'Assurance maladie de la Sécurité sociale
(CPAM/Améli). Bien qu'elle ne soit pas obligatoire, nous vous recommandons
fortement d’en contracter une. Cela vous sera très utile si vous êtes malade,
si vous devez subir un examen médical ou être hospitalisé.

Here is the contact of a « Mutual health insurance » for students from which
you can get information and help to choose a contract adapted to your needs /
Voici le contact d'une « Mutuelle assurance santé » destinée aux étudiants,
auprès de laquelle vous pourrez obtenir des informations et de l'aide pour
faire le choix d'un contrat adapté à vos besoins.

You can get 10% discount with the code **95ESSEC-10**

Vous bénéficierez d'une remise de 10% avec le code **95ESSEC-10**

Social Security Health Plan/ Sécurité So.page_content:
** _Situation for those arrived before 31/12/2020_**

If you moved to France before the end of the transition period set on December
31, 2020, your health insurance coverage and the conditions under which you
are insured do not change for the duration of your studies. You must present
the new "Brexit" European health insurance card (CEAM or EHIC) with the
country code FR.

We advise you to apply for French national health insurance through:
<https://etudiant-etranger.ameli.fr/#/>

To receive reimbursement for your health care expenses at the highest possible
rate, you can take out supplementary health care coverage or coverage from a
mutual fund ("mutuelle").

** _Situation for those arrived after 31/12/2020_**

British nationals coming to study in France after the end of the transition
period, i.e. from 1 January 2021, must hold a residence permit and must apply
for the French health insurance coverage.

You must apply on the website [etudiant-
etranger.ameli.fr](https://urldefense.com/v3/__http:/etudiant-
etranger.ameli.fr/__;!!GfvddVNH!UFaDPC4dYrZyVko16ugHzle0fw1OVUiNZdhtUNErV_QYD60nkdv877gbovTiFtsPisay2ogJ%24
"http://etudiant-etranger.ameli.fr

Ctrl+Cliquer ou appuyer pour suivre le lien")

The required documents are:

  * Inscription certificate from ESSEC
  * Your ID
  * Birth certificate (with mention of your parents’ names)
  * Bank account details (RIB)
  * Your French residence permit

To receive reimbursement for your health care expenses at the highest possible
rate, you can take out supplementary health care coverage or coverage from a
mutual fund ("mutuelle").

En tant qu'apprenti(e), vous êtes assuré(e) social et relevez du régime
général de la Sécurité sociale. Vous bénéficiez de la même protection sociale
qu'un salarié, notamment :

  * du remboursement de vos soins en cas de maladie ;
  * et, sous réserve de remplir les conditions d'ouverture de droits applicables aux salariés, du versement d'indemnités journalières en cas d'arrêt de travail pour maladie, et des prestations des assurances invalidité et décès.

Vous êtes couvert(e) en cas d'accident du travail ou de maladie
professionnelle et ce, dès le 1er jour de votre apprentissage, que l'accident
du travail survienne dans l'entreprise, au CFA, ou à l'occasion des trajets
entre votre domicile et les différents lieux de l'apprentissage.

**Quelles démarches dois-je effectuer?**

  

Vous devez déclarer le changement de votre situation vu que vous avez
désormais une activité salariée. Veuillez envoyer par la voie postale les
documents suivants à votre CPAM locale :

  * [Formulaire S1106](https://www.ameli.fr/sites/default/files/formulaires/168/s1106_-_demande_puma_-_assurance_maladie.pdf)
  * Pièce d'identité
  * Titre de séjour en cours de validité (pour les étudiants non européens)
  * Dernier bulletin de salaire ou le contrat d'apprentissage
  * RIB

===========================================

  

_Please refer mainly to the intranet of the CFA of ESSEC which covers all the
subjects you need to know._

_

[ESSEC Apprenticeship Grande
Ecole](https://essec.jobteaser.com/fr/handbook/articles/13813?school_id=3171&from_theme=true)

[Apprenticeship Global
BBA](https://essec.jobteaser.com/fr/handbook/articles/173)

 _  
_

_  
_

_As an apprentice, you are insured and subject to the general social security
system. You benefit from the same social protection as an employee, in
particular;_

  * _reimbursement of your care in the event of illness;_
  * _the payment of daily allowances in the event of sick leave, disability and death insurance benefits (subject to conditions for entitlement to applicable rights)_

_  
_

_You are covered in the event of an accident at work or occupational disease,
from the first day of your apprenticeship, whether the accident at work occurs
at your workplace, at the CFA, or during the transit between your home and
different apprentice sites._

_  
_

_**What steps do I need to take?**_

_  
_

_You need to declare the change of your situation since you receive salary.
Please send the following documents to your local CPAM office by the post:_

  * _[Form S1106](https://www.ameli.fr/sites/default/files/formulaires/168/s1106_-_demande_puma_-_assurance_maladie.pdf)_
  *  _Passport or ID card_
  *  _Valid residence permit (for Non-European students)_
  * _Last pay slip or employment contract_
  *  _French bank account details (RIB)_

_  
_

_**Reminder:**_

_Non-European students who are enrolled in France for the first time and hold
a student residence permit in the form of a long stay student visa combined
with the visa validation obtained upon arrival , may NOT do an apprenticeship
during this first year. They must wait until they renew their residence permit
and get their permit in the form of a laminated card before they become
eligible for apprenticeship and the APT (see all the FAQs on that specific
subject)._

Social Security Health Plan/ Sécurité So.page_content:
(English below)

  

**_C'est quoi la Complémentaire santé solidaire ou la CSS ?_**

  

La CSS est une mutuelle qui vous aide à payer vos dépenses de santé si vous
avez des **ressources modestes**. Pour plus d'information, veuillez consulter
le site web d'Ameli sur [la CSS](https://www.ameli.fr/val-d-
oise/assure/droits-demarches/difficultes-acces-droits-soins/complementaire-
sante/complementaire-sante-solidaire-qui-peut-en-beneficier-et-comment).

  

**_What is the CSS?_**

  

The CSS is a complimentary health insurance which can help you pay for your
health care expenses if you have **modest income**. It can cover the cost for
the following services:

  

  * Doctor
  * Dentist
  * Nurse
  * Hospital
  * Medication
  * Physiotherapist

  

Furthermore, it can help you pay the cost of other services such as:

  

  * Dentures
  * Glasses
  * Hearing aid
  * Medical equipment

  

**Who can apply for the CSS?**

  

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7137158588/original/kxoiXXskSPliAsytTv8BCsdiyFuQC4IarA.png?1709029679)

You need to have an active social security file

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7137158788/original/M3_lbAj42Tkf7lucyqHN7Ppj5TmnSMjs8Q.png?1709029739)

Your income cannot exceed the maximum limit

  

Test your eligibility **[here](https://www.ameli.fr/val-d-oise/assure/droits-
demarches/difficultes-acces-droits-soins/complementaire-sante/simulateur-de-
droits)**.

  

**_Conditions related to your income_**

  

The CPAM needs to know your income for the last 12 months preceding the
penultimate month of your application. That is why it's very important to
declare **all your income** when applying, such as:

  

  * Your salaries, allowances etc.
  * Regular financial aid (grants, housing subsidies, contributions from the family etc.)
  * All profit you make, from games for example

  

** _What is the limit?_**

![](https://s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/euc-
cdn.freshdesk.com/data/helpdesk/attachments/production/7137164344/original/0n8KS3R3PSpAh9WkRMUfkOs4yA4ir8xLFw.png?1709031466)

If you are 30 years old or more, the monthly cost is 14€.

  

**_How do I apply?_**

  

You can apply online on your [Ameli](http://www.ameli.fr) account or by
filling out the attached form. You will need to send the form with the
documents needed as well to your local CPAM office.

Please keep in mind the following:

  

  * The carte vitale is **_free of cost_ **and **_does not expire_**

  * CPAM offices **never ask** for bank account nor personal information by email or SMS. If needed, they ask for information via the [Ameli account](http://ameli.fr).

  * If you lose your carte vitale card and need to re-apply for it, please do so on your [Ameli account](http://ameli.fr).

Vous ressentez le besoin d'aide psychologique ? Santé Psy est un nouveau
dispositif qui vous permet de bénéficier gratuitement de 8 séances auprès d'un
psychologue agréé. Comment ça marche?

  

  1. Consultez votre médecin généraliste afin d'obtenir l'ordonnance pour la consultation psychologique.
  2. Choisissez votre psychologue **[ici](https://santepsy.etudiant.gouv.fr/trouver-un-psychologue)**
  3. Bénéficiez de vos 8 séances gratuites

  

Rendez-vous sur **[Santé Psy](https://santepsy.etudiant.gouv.fr/) **pour plus
d'information.

  

**D'autres mesures de soutien :**

  * Se rendre dans un [**BAPU**](https://annuaire.action-sociale.org/etablissements/jeunes-handicapes/bureau-d-aide-psychologique-universitaire--b-a-p-u---221.html) (Bureau d'aide psychologique universitaire). Ce sont des centres de consultation pour les étudiants souhaitant une aide psychologique. Les consultations sont prises en charge 100% par la sécurité sociale et les mutuelles. 
  * Appeler **[Nightline](https://www.nightline.fr/)** , un service d'écoute et de soutien assuré par des étudiants bénévoles et pour des étudiants.

  

================================

  

Do you feel the need to seek for psychological aid? Santé Psy is a new feature
allowing you to get up to 8 sessions with a registered psychologist completely
free of charge. How does it work?

  

  1. Consult your doctor to get the prescription for the psychological consultation.
  2. Choose your psychologist [**here**](https://santepsy.etudiant.gouv.fr/trouver-un-psychologue)
  3. Benefit from your 8 free sessions

More information on **[Santé Psy](https://santepsy.etudiant.gouv.fr/)**

  

**Other measures of support:**

  * Go to one of the [**BAPU**](https://annuaire.action-sociale.org/etablissements/jeunes-handicapes/bureau-d-aide-psychologique-universitaire--b-a-p-u---221.html) centres. They are consultation centres for students seeking psychological help. The consultations are 100% covered by the social security and the complimentary health insurances (mutuelle).
  * Call the **[Nightline](https://www.nightline.fr/)** , helpline and psychological support for students by volunteering students.

Housing.page_content:
In case you'd like to rent a private place, outside ESSEC residences you
should be aware of the following:

  

\- you'll be required to have a guarantor in France. This is not easy for a
non French person. See in attachment the Garantme Flyer that might be a
solution.

\- you'll be required to provide evidence of housing insurance (see [article
in our FAQ on that
subject](https://ernest.essec.edu/support/solutions/articles/7000015103-assurance-
habitation-housing-insurance)) before you can get the keys of your apartment

\- you should ask whether or not the apartment is furnished

\- you should ask what is included in the rent (utilities, residence tax,
telephone line, etc)

\- you should plan to pay one or two extra months when you move in. This is
kept as a guarantee and should be refunded when you leave provided that your
place is in impeccable condition.

\- you should plan to pay agency fees if you used an agency's services.

\- you should try to avoid to pay in cash.

\- you should visit the place before you move in.

\- you should budget any kind of additional cost (transportation, commuting
time, etc.)

This list is not exhaustive.

*******

  

Si vous souhaitez louer un appartement privé au lieu d'habiter dans l'une des
résidences de l'ESSEC, vous devez prévoir ceci:

  

\- vous devrez avoir un garant, ce qui n'est pas simple si vous n'êtes pas
français. Voir la proposition Garantme en pièce jointe qui pourrait être une
solution.

\- vous devrez fournir votre attestation d'assurance habitation (voir [article
à ce sujet dans nos
FAQ](https://ernest.essec.edu/support/solutions/articles/7000015103-assurance-
habitation-housing-insurance)) avant de pouvoir obtenir les clefs de votre
logement

\- vous devez vous renseigner si l'appartement est meublé ou non

\- vous devez demander ce qui est inclus dans le loyer (électricité,
chauffage, tax d'habitation, ligne de téléphone, etc.)

\- vous devez prévoir de payer un ou deux mois de loyer en plus lorsque vous
emménagez. Cela servira de caution qui vous sera remboursée lorsque vous
partirez à condition que le logement soit dans un état impeccable.

\- vous devez prévoir des frais d'agence si vous avez recouru aux services
d'une agence.

\- vous devez éviter de payer en espèces.

\- vous devez visiter le lieu avant d'emménager.

\- vous devez prévoir toutes sortes de coûts supplémentaires (transport, temps
d'acheminement, etc.)

Cette liste n'est pas exhaustive.

ESSEC Alumni.page_content:
English version below -

  

En intégrant l’ESSEC, vous rejoignez également la communauté des alumni.

  

Grâce à une cotisation unique pour la vie, vous bénéficiez d'un accès illimité
à l'ensemble des services d’ESSEC Alumni dès votre premier jour à l’Ecole et
tout au long de votre vie professionnelle.

  

Ce système est devenu le modèle de référence des grandes universités
internationales (Harvard, Yale, Cambridge) et des grandes business schools
(HEC, EMLyon, EDHEC…).

  

Cela permet à l’association des Alumni de consacrer 100% de son temps et de
ses moyens à répondre aux besoins des étudiants et diplômés.

  

C’est grâce à la participation de chacun qu'il est possible de construire un
réseau efficace et solidaire, et proposer ainsi une aide à tous et pour toute
la vie. Dans cet esprit d’équité et de solidarité, ESSEC Alumni s’aligne sur
l’abattement des frais de scolarité accordé aux boursiers pour réduire le
montant de leur cotisation à vie (cf. article dédié aux étudiants boursiers).

  

**Pour en savoir plus sur les services et outils proposés par ESSEC Alumni,
rendez-vous sur le campus de Cergy, en face du K-Lab ou contactez l'équipe
dédiée :[alumni-oncampus@essec.edu](mailto:alumni-oncampus@essec.edu) **

  

[Consultez les services et ressources d'ESSEC
Alumni](https://www.essecalumni.com/page/services-etudiants).

  

***************

  

When you join ESSEC, you also join the Alumni community.

  

Thanks to a single lifetime membership fee, you benefit from unlimited access
to all ESSEC Alumni services from your first day at the School and throughout
your professional life.

  

This system has become the reference model for major international
universities (Harvard, Yale, Cambridge) and business schools (HEC, EMLyon,
EDHEC...).

  

This enables the Alumni Association to devote 100% of its time and resources
to meeting the needs of students and graduates.

  

Thanks to everyone's contribution we're able to build up an effective and
supportive network, offering lifelong support to all. In this spirit of
fairness and solidarity, ESSEC Alumni is aligning itself with the tuition fee
reduction granted to scholarship holders to reduce their lifetime membership
fees (see article aimed at scholarship holders).

  

**To find out more about the services and resources offered by ESSEC Alumni,
visit their office at the Cergy campus, opposite the K-Lab, or contact the
dedicated team:[alumni-oncampus@essec.edu](mailto:alumni-oncampus@essec.edu)
**

  

[Link to ESSEC Alumni services](https://www.essecalumni.com/page/services-
etudiants)

ESSEC Alumni.page_content:
English version below -

  

**Dès votre premier jour à l’ESSEC, vous rejoignez un réseau de près de 70 000
alumni réunissant étudiants et diplômés, présents dans le monde entier et dans
tous les secteurs avec une grande diversité de parcours inspirants.**

**L’importance du réseau n’est plus à prouver : aujourd’hui, près de 70% des
jobs se trouvent grâce au réseau.**

**Il existe encore néanmoins de nombreux préjugés autour du réseau. Le réseau,
c’est avant tout une démarche qui s’apprend et qui prend du temps.**

  

**1\. L'Association ESSEC Alumni**

  

ESSEC Alumni est l’association qui fédère et anime ce réseau. C’est un
collectif pour échanger, partager, s’entraider.

La mission générale d’ESSEC Alumni est d’aider tous les alumni (étudiants et
diplômés) à déployer leur potentiel et démultiplier leur impact grâce à la
puissance du collectif.

  

L’ensemble de l’activité et des services proposés par ESSEC Alumni s’articule
autour de 4 piliers stratégiques :

  

**Support** : accompagner les alumni à chaque étape de leur trajectoire
professionnelle et quels que soient leurs besoins

  

**Connect** : aider les ESSEC à se connecter, à se rencontrer autour
d’événements, en France et à l’international, notamment via les Clubs
(professionnels, loisirs, régionaux) et les Chapters internationaux

  

**Inspire** : partager les parcours inspirants d’alumni qui font rayonner les
valeurs de l’ESSEC (humanisme, innovation, responsabilité, ouverture)

  

**Together to Act** : encourager les ESSEC à agir ensemble pour le bien commun
(mentorat, solidarité…) et à inventer de nouveaux modèles sociétaux
(transition environnementale et sociale)

  

Pour en savoir plus sur l’association : rendez-vous sur
[essecalumni.com](//essecalumni.com)

  

  

**2\. Une équipe et des services ESSEC Alumni dédiés à la communauté
étudiante**

  

ESSEC Alumni propose des services dédiés aux étudiants pour vous aider à :

  

\- Construire votre réseau

\- Interagir avec un maximum de diplômés tout au long de votre scolarité

\- Trouver une opportunité professionnelle via le réseau

  

Alumni Talks, échanges avec des diplômés en one-to-one, Masterclasses réseau,
rendez-vous individuels, ateliers et talks : de nombreux événements et
services sont proposés tout au long de votre scolarité en complément de
l’accompagnement des Career Services.

  

**  
**

**3\. Les outils du réseau**

  

\- Des Clubs professionnels et des Chapters internationaux (tous ouverts aux
étudiants)

\- L’annuaire en ligne des alumni

\- Le réseau ESSEC sur LinkedIn :

Le Groupe privé LinkedIn ESSEC Alumni avec plus de 20 000 membres et la page
ESSEC Alumni

La page ESSEC Business School avec plus de 105 000 abonnés

  

***************

  

**From your very first day at ESSEC, you join a network of nearly 70,000
alumni, students and graduates from all over the world and in all sectors,
with a wide variety of inspiring backgrounds.**

**The importance of networking has been proven: today, nearly 70% of jobs are
found through networking.**

**However, there are still many preconceived ideas about networking. Above
all, networking is a learning process that takes time.**

  

**1\. The ESSEC Alumni Association**

  

This network is united and led by the ESSEC Alumni association to create
exchange, sharing and mutual aid.

The general mission of ESSEC Alumni is to help all alumni (students and
graduates) to deploy their potential and multiply their impact thanks to
collective power.

  

All the activities and services offered by ESSEC Alumni are structured around
4 strategic pillars:

  

**Support** : coach alumni at every stage of their career path, whatever their
needs.

  

**Connect** : help ESSEC alumni to connect and meet at events in France and
abroad, notably through Clubs (professional, leisure, regional) and
international Chapters.

  

**Inspire** : share the inspiring stories of alumni who radiate ESSEC values
(humanism, innovation, responsibility, openness)

  

**Together to Act** : encourage ESSECs to act together for the common good
(mentoring, solidarity, etc.) and to invent new societal models (environmental
and social transition).

  

To find out more about the association: visit
[essecalumni.com](//essecalumni.com)

  

  

**2\. An ESSEC Alumni team and services dedicated to the student community**

  

ESSEC Alumni offers dedicated student services to help you :

  

\- Build your network

\- Interact with as many alumni as possible throughout your studies

\- Find a professional opportunity through the network

  

Alumni Talks, one-to-one exchanges with graduates, Network Masterclasses,
individual meetings, workshops and talks: numerous events and services are
offered throughout your studies, in addition to Career Services support.

  

  

**3\. Network tools**

  

\- Professional Clubs and International Chapters (all open to students)

\- Online alumni directory

\- The ESSEC network on LinkedIn:

The private LinkedIn ESSEC Alumni Group with over 20,000 members and the ESSEC
Alumni page

The ESSEC Business School page with over 105,000 subscribers

Security / Précautions.page_content:
As a piece of advice we recommend that students keep an **electronic copy**
(eventually in a cloud data archiving solution) of their ID documents such as

\- passport, visa, residence permit,

\- birth certificate,

\- insurance (health, housing, travel),

\- medical records,

\- prescription, etc,

so as to access their own records any time if need be.

  

Then, if they wish to do so, students can grant access to the person of their
choice at any given time, for any time period.

  

On campus, foreign students (i.e non French, non EU) may carry a photocopy of
their passport along with the photocopy of their French student residence
permit to avoid loss or theft.

They must provide the registrar's office with a scanned copy of some of their
documents upon enrollment.

  

*******

_Nous conseillons à nos étudiants de conserver une**copie
électronique**(éventuellement dans un coffre-fort digital) de leurs pièces
d'identité telles que _

 _\- passeport, carte de séjour,_

_\- acte de naissance,_

_\- attestation d'assurance (santé, habitation, voyage),_

_\- dossier médical,_

_\- ordonnances, etc,_

_de façon à pouvoir y accéder à tout moment en cas de besoin._

_  
_

_Ensuite, s'ils le souhaitent, les étudiants peuvent accorder l'accès aux
personnes de leur choix à n'importe quel moment, pour n'importe quelle durée._

_  
_

_Sur le campus, les étudiants étrangers (i.e non français, non européens) sont
autorisés à porter une photocopie de leur passeport ainsi que de leur carte de
séjour française afin d'éviter les vols ou les pertes._

_Ils doivent impérativement fournir au bureau du registraire une copie de
certains de leurs documents au moment de leur inscription._

Il est possible que lors d'un recrutement, une entreprise demande un extrait
de casier judiciaire. Vous pouvez le demander en ligne et l'obtenir
gratuitement. Cette démarche peut être faite par toute personne ayant séjourné
sur le territoire français, quelle que soit la nationalité (française ou
étrangère), le lieu de naissance (en France ou à l'étranger).

  

[Demande d'extrait de casier judiciaire en ligne](https://www.service-
public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F1420)

  

**************

You may be required by a company to provide a so-called "extrait de casier
judiciaire", which is a certificate indicating whether or not you had criminal
records in France, or simply your judicial status. You may proceed online,
free of charge. Any individual - French or foreign, born in France or abroad -
, who has resided in France may obtain this document.

  

[To request the so-called extrait de casier judiciaire
online](https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F1420)

* Vous partez en voyage à l’étranger ?

Avant de partir en voyage, nous vous conseillons de souscrire une assurance
privée et de vous inscrire sur
[Ariane](https://pastel.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fildariane).

Vous devrez créer votre compte utilisateur et enregistrer votre voyage avant
votre départ. Vous devrez notamment préciser votre itinéraire et vos lieux de
passage, vos coordonnées et les noms de vos accompagnants le cas échéant.

  * Pourquoi inscrire son voyage sur Ariane ?

Pour être alerté en cas de crise à l’étranger.

Vous serez contacté par mail ou SMS au cas où des opérations de secours
seraient organisées. Une personne de contact désignée par vous-même pourra
également être contactée le cas échéant.

  * Qui peut s’inscrire sur Ariane ? 

Les voyageurs français, qu’ils vivent en France ou à l’étranger, peuvent
s’inscrire pour enregistrer un voyage touristique, professionnel ou encore
personnel d’une durée de moins de 6 mois.

Une application gratuite est aussi disponible.

étapes de l'inscription en ligne dans l'ordre, sans en omettre aucune, jusqu'à
ce que vous receviez le message "Dossier d'inscription complété".

Si pour une raison quelconque, cliquer sur MyRegistrar à partir de MyESSEC ne
vous permet pas d'y accéder, il est possible qu'il y ait des difficultés de
réseau, en particulier en période de travaux de maintenance.

  

Dans ce cas, cliquez sur le lien qui vous a été envoyé par courriel par notre
équipe du bureau du registraire

Pour Cergy <https://essec.myintranet.online/>

Pour Singapour [https://essecasiapacific.myintranet.online/
](https://essecasiapacific.myintranet.online/%C2%A0)

  

Connectez-vous grâce à vos identifiants habituels.

  

**Ne pas confondre MyESSEC et MyRegistrar : même si votre accès à MyESSEC est
bloqué, vous pouvez toujours accéder à MyRegistrar par le lien**
<https://essec.myintranet.online/>

*******************

 **1) First-time enrolled students**

enrollment in chronological order without skipping any until you receive the
message "Enrollment file completed".

access to the registrar's intranet, this may be due to technical outage, in
particular during maintenance work.

  

In that case, try to click directly on the link below, sent per e-mail by our
team of the registrar's office

In Cergy <https://essec.myintranet.online/>

In Singapore [https://essecasiapacific.myintranet.online/
](https://essecasiapacific.myintranet.online/%C2%A0)

  

Use the same access codes as usual.

locked, you can still access MyRegistrar via the link**
<https://essec.myintranet.online/>

**1\. To learn French**

See app in Ukrainian in the attached flyer.

  

**2\. Financial Aid**

**3.1 From CROUS**

Students enrolled at ESSEC may apply for need-based scholarships from
CROUS**if they benefit from the so-called "protection temporaire"**. These
scholarships are distinct from the emergency scholarship.

  

**3.2 From Erasmus Agency**

Students enrolled at ESSEC may apply for an Erasmus scholarship that will come
as an aid for their living expenses.

**3\. "Protection temporaire"**

More details
**[HERE](https://www.interieur.gouv.fr/actualites/dossiers/situation-en-
ukraine/information-a-destination-des-personnes-deplacees-dukraine)** on
**Protection temporaire.**

**See in attachments the Application for Protection temporaire, one in French,
one in Ukrainian.**

  

  

**4\. Various links**

  

**<https://www.facebook.com/solidariteukraine95/>**

  

**5\. To obtain a French residence permit**

Last update from March 15th 2022, please come back for further regular update.
You can also go direcly to [this page of Prefecture du Val
d'Oise](https://www.val-doise.gouv.fr/Actualites/Solidarite-avec-l-Ukraine)
(in French).

**Coming to France** during the crisis:

\- with a valid biometric Ukrainian passport

\- with a valid non-biometric Ukrainian passport and a visa issued in one of
Ukraine's border states.

  

**Once in France** , special measures have been taken by the French home
ministry because of the war:

These measure apply to:

\- Ukrainian citizens who left Ukraine from February 24th

\- Ukrainian citizens who were in France before that date for a short stay

\- Ukrainians who obtained the refugee status before the war

\- Foreigners who lived in Ukraine before the war with a valid Ukrainian
residence permit and who cannot go back to their home country

  

People in one of the above-mentioned situations will be delivered a 6-month
French residence permit ("_Autorisation Provisoire de Séjour_ "). It can be
renewed.

  

This special residence permit gives access to the following rights:

\- housing

\- eligibility to asylum seeker subsidy subject to income level (Allocation
pour Demandeur d'Asile)

\- work permit (request must be made by the potential employer)

\- affiliation to the French health insurance scheme with no waiting period
and one-year supplemental health insurance coverage

\- eligibility to housing subsidy

\- access to school for minors

  

Applications must be made through a special counter at the Préfecture open
between 8.30 am and 3 pm Monday through Friday. No appointment is requested.

  

No residence permit (APS) can be issued without a valid address in France.

The following documents will be mandatory:

\- APS application form

\- housing proof

\- biometric passport

\- non-biometric passport + visa

\- 4 ID photos

\- passport stamp indicating the arrival date in the Schengen area or any
travel proof from Ukraine to France

  

Ukrainian citizens will be able to apply for asylum later through the OFII
phone platform : 01 42 500 900

  

Ukrainian citizens who were in France before the war with a soon-to-expire
residence permit  can apply for the renewal of their residence permit through
the Préfecture or sous-Préfecture in charge of their place of residence.

  

During this crisis, information can be provided by contacting the préfecture
at pref-etrangers@val-doise.gouv.fr

  

This information is subject to change and can be updated at any time.
